TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 363-364
TEI.2.document_title: William C Carpenter to James F Perry, 04-07-1830

barker_notes.barker_summary: William C. Carpenter to James F. Perry, April 7, 1830. Bill of lading, New Orleans to Texas.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 363-364

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*William C. Carpenter to James F. Perry, April 7, 1830. Bill of lading, New Orleans to Texas.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*Shipped, in good order and well-conditioned, by John Q. Stevenson *location_mentioned*on board the Schooner the Pocahontas*/location_mentioned* whereof *person_mentioned*Carpenter, is master,*/person_mentioned* now lying *location_mentioned*in the port of New-Orleans,*/location_mentioned* and bound for *location_mentioned*Brazoria Texas*/location_mentioned**/p* *p*To say:*/p*
*p*Four Keys Bar Lead.*/p*
*p*Two Boxes hats, One mattress*/p*
*p*One Bale shirting, One Fireiron*/p*
*p*One Pair Smiths tongs, One Bellows*/p*
*p*One Anvil, Ten Bars Steel,*/p*
*p*Two Bundles, One Vice, Twelve*/p*
*p*Bars iron, Seven Plough Moulds*/p* *p*being marked and numbered as in the margin, and are to be delivered in the like order and condition, at the *location_mentioned*port of Texas */location_mentioned* (the dangers of the *location_mentioned*seas */location_mentioned*only excepted) unto *person_mentioned*Mr. J. F. Perry*/person_mentioned* or to his assigns, he or they paying freight for the said at the rate of forty cents per each cubic foot------------with 5 Sents primage and average accustomed. In witness whereof, the *person_mentioned*master*/person_mentioned* or *person_mentioned*purser */person_mentioned*of the said vessel hath affirmed to 3 Bills of Lading, all of this tenor and date; one of which being accomplished, the others to stand void.*/p*
*p*Dated in *location_mentioned*New-Orleans*/location_mentioned*, the *date_mentioned n="04-07-1830">7th day of April 1830*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*William C Carpenter*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
